column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Is that who you were reading at that age ?

#Text=When I became more mature , if that 's the word , it was about my senior year , going to college , 17 , 18 , 19 years of age , I fell under the sway of the classic writers who were the generation or two before my own .
#Text=Namely , Fitzgerald and Hemingway , and to a lesser degree Faulkner .
#Text=I went to Alabama College , as you know .
#Text=I assume you know .
#Text=And so Faulkner was a name I reckoned with .
#Text=And then , while I was still in college in my third year there , fourth year there , I started reading The New Yorker and reading the great stories of John O'Hara and Irwin Shaw and others ...
#Text=John Cheever .
#Text=All those stories and all those writers I mentioned give detail .
#Text=They are really descriptive writers , scenic writers , writers of city life

#Text=whether it 's Fitzgerald invoking the sense of St. Paul , Minnesota or Coming To Princeton , his novel , or Irwin Shaw walking through the streets of the city of New York or O'Hara getting into New York with a chip on his shoulder from Pennsylvania or later on their literary inheritors , John Updike , William Styron , those other people closer to my generation .
#Text=Philip Roth is my favorite writer .
#Text=They all gave a sense of reality .
#Text=Roth gives a real sense of history .
#Text=I 've read every novel he 's written .
#Text=I 've read The Plot Against America .
#Text=Yeah , well that 's a distorted sense of the Wilke campaign .
#Text=But you really get a sense of time and place with Roth , including his latest novel .
#Text=All of his novels , every one of them .
#Text=And I 've never been tempted , with one exception , to write fiction .
#Text=One exception being I did write a short story in 1965 and got it published and I was never interested in writing again because I thought reality is so remarkable .
#Text=All you have to do is spend the time , take the time , and you 're going to find things that are hardly believable that are real .
#Text=At least real to the degree that you say , this is as verifiable as it gets .
#Text=I 'm not saying it 's the truth , the full truth , the half truth , but this is at least something that did indeed happen , at least in the minds of those to whom it happened .
#Text=And you are a chronicler of their reality .
#Text=And you can write stories without changing names and altering the facts .
#Text=And they sound as if they are concocted , imagined works of fiction , but they 're not .
#Text=They 're not works of fiction .
#Text=But my reading was fiction and remains fiction .
#Text=I do n't read much non-fiction unless I have to .
#Text=If I want to write about China then I 'm going to read biographies of Mao .

#Text=Or if I want to write about Unto The Sons , which is my book about my ancestry in Italy , I have to read all these book about Naples or 20th Century Mafia in Palermo or the English writers who were the great travel writers of the 19th century .
